author: jonbuddy
title: Good Game
review:
Even though all those people thought Galidor was really bad, I liked it. The game was cool, the idea was too. The sets...Not so much. :(

Good:
Tons of Levels
Good Graphics

Bad:
A highly used plotline (Evil guy wants to "Rule the Dimension" or something of that sort)

Overall:

1 Bad, 2 Goods, shapes up to be a:

4.6/5
or
9.6/10

author: BulkFan98
title: Better Than The Theme
review:
I'm in the middle of playing this game, and I've got to say, it's much better than the show and the sets.
The plot basically follows the plot of the show, which probably isn't the best ideas, but it's not the worst either (I mean, Batman Begins did the same thing, and look at how that turned out).
Anywho, let's look at the pros and cons:
Pros:
Good controls
Nice graphics

Cons:
Not the best control scheme I've seen on a Game Boy Advance game.
The music needs improvement.
It is Galidor, after all.

All in all, I'd say, if You have a GBA or a GBA emulator, get this game.
